intro: Arabis subflava, commonly known as the yellow rockcress, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Its yellow flowers, which bloom in spring, are arranged in clusters and are accompanied by linear, grass-like leaves. Arabis subflava is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in harsh, well-drained environments.
